section.title: Knowing the Difference Between Cross References and Links
Problem
section.para: You want to set a link but you do not know which DocBook element to use.

section.title: Solution
section.para: DocBook distinguishes between two link types:

section.title: Discussion
section.para: There are several differences between xref and link. An xref is used for cross referencing another part of the document. In its simplest form, you only need an ID value of the object that you want to refer:

example.title: A Cross Reference
example.programlisting: <chapter xml:id="tea"> <title>All About Tea</title> <section xml:id="about-tea"> <title>About Tea</title> <para>This section gives you an introduction about tea.</para> </section> <section xml:id="prepar"> <title>Preparing Tea</title> <para>Read an introduction in <xref linkend="about-tea"/>.</para> </section> </chapter>

section.para: The DocBook XSL stylesheets take care of resolving the xref. By default, it replaces the xref element with a number and the title of the reference. It could look like this:
section.screen: Read an introduction in Section 1.1, “About Tea”.
section.para: The text Section 1.1, “About Tea” is a hot link and points to the respective section. Using xref for cross references has several advantages:

listitem.para: Whenever a text of a title changes, all xrefs pointing to it will automatically change too.
During validation, the linkend attribute is checked for existence.
During resolution, additional words like Section, Chapter, or Figure are automatically inserted according to the document language.
You do not have to care about numbering.

itemizedlist.listitem: For further customization, use the xrefstyle attribute.

section.para: In contrast, a link is used in most cases for external links.

example.title: A Hyperlink
example.programlisting: <section xml:id="about-tea"> <title>About Tea</title> <para>See <link xlink:href="http://www.example.org/tea"/> for further information.</para> </section>

section.para: Using link has the following advantages:

listitem.para: Usually no automatic resolution is performed (only if you use xlink:href).
No validation is necessary between source and target.
The link content can be created manually.
